document_data.mainbody:
Masakito Matsutomo was a head of the Matsutomo clan and a daimyo of Aru Province in Wa in the early 1700s on the Wa Calendar.
In , the shogun returned Aru Province to the Matsutomo clan, appointing Masakito as daimyo. Vowing to do better than his ancestors in the role, Masakito was efficient and enlightened, if strict, but too old to reign for long. He died in  and was succeeded by his son, Hisao.
